translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The reverse order of the dependent origination, the text of the Paṭṭhāna in pairs

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.🔽Nahetuṁ nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ🔽nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu sahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nahetuṁ🔽nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca hetu sahetuko ca nahetu sahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nanahetuṁ nasahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu sahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  na hetum na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca hetu sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetu  na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na hetu  na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca hetu sa hetukaḥ ca na hetu sa hetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  na na hetum na sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: Nanahetu naahetuko dhammo nahetussa ahetukassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na na hetu na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ na hetussa ahetukassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state without root-cause is related to a state without root-cause as root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare cha …pe… sahajāte aññamaññe🔽cattāri, nissaye pañca, upanissaye cha, purejāte tīṇi, āsevane ekaṁ …pe… sampayutte🔽ekaṁ, vippayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.🔽Pañhāvāraṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.🔽Nahetuṁ naahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu ahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare cha pe sahajāte aññamaññe  cattāri nissaye pañca upanissaye cha purejāte tīṇi āsevane ekam pe sampayutte  eka vippayutte tīṇi pe avigate pañca  pañhāvāram  na hetum na ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: In the section on root-cause, there is one triad and one dyad. In the section on object, there are six triads and six dyads. In the section on predominance, there are three triads and three dyads. In the section on proximity, there are six triads and six dyads. … In the section on presence, there are six triads and six dyads. … In the section on non-disappearance, there are six triads and six dyads.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… sahajāte pañca, aññamaññe cattāri …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe sahajāte pañca aññamaññe cattāri pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate pañca
translated: With respect to cause, there are three. With respect to object, there is one. … With respect to association, there are five. With respect to dissociation, there are four. … With respect to result, there are three. … With respect to the unincluded, there are five.
